frame.name: Cause_to_land
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Operator</fen> maneuvers onto land a <fen>Vehicle</fen> which typically does not operate on land, e.g., an airplane or boat.
<ex><fex name="ope">The terrified pilot</fex> <t>landed</t> <fex name="veh">the passenger-filled airplane</fex> <fex name="Goal">into the river</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Vehicle
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Vehicle</fen> ends up stationary on land.
<ex>She <t>landed</t> <fex name="veh">the plane</fex> on an unoccupied airstrip.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Source</fen> is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While <fen>Source</fen> expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent.
<ex>We tried to <t>land</t> the helicopter <fex name="src">from the east</fex> to avoid detection.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>. In this frame, <fen>Path</fen> expressions almost always have a via-sense.
<ex>He wasn't willing to <t>land</t> the plane <fex name="Path">through lightning and rain</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Goal</fen> is any expression that tells where the <fen>Vehicle</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
<ex>They <t>set</t> planes <t>down</t> <fex name="Goal">on the strip</fex> before midnight.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Manner</fen> expression describes a property of landing which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions.
<ex>The pilot <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex> <t>put down</t> the plane and let the police approach.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which a <fen>Operator</fen> lands a <fen>Vehicle</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Cotheme
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Cotheme</fen> is a second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique.
<ex>Jones <t>landed</t> the <fex name="Cotheme">with three planes which were flying in close formation</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Operator</fen> lands teh <fen>Vehicle</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: New_situation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>New_situation</fen> are the state of the <fen>Goal</fen> when the <fen>Vehicle</fen> arrives.
<ex>I dream of <t>landing</t> <fex name="veh">a troop carrier</fex> <fex name="New_situation">to a standing ovation</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Depictive</fen> is a phrase which describes the state of the <fen>Operator</fen> or <fen>Vehicle</fen> upon arrival.
<ex>We were forced to land <fex name="Vehicle">the small passender plane</fex> <fex name="Depictive">unaware of the conditions on the ground</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period within which the landing event repeats multiple times.
</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the landing event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Operator</fen> lands the <fen>Vehicle</fen> at the <fen>Goal</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE marks the state of affairs reported by the landing event as understood to play a role in the state of affairs of <fen>Event_description</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Operator</fen> lands the <fen>Vehicle</fen> at the <fen>Goal</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the landing occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Operator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Operator</fen> maneuvers the vehicle onto land.
<fex name="ope">A skilled pilot</fex> would never <t>set</t> a plane <t>down</t> in weather like this.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: land.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bring a vehicle to stop on land, rather than the typical medium of travel.

lexUnit.name: set down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bring an aircraft down to the ground.
